remarks: Conditions for a free module to be a pre-Hilbert space.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 21-Jun-2019.)  (Proof shortened by AV, 21-Jul-2019.)
statement:
frlmphl.y $e |- Y = ( R freeLMod I ) $.
frlmphl.b $e |- B = ( Base ` R ) $.
frlmphl.t $e |- .x. = ( .r ` R ) $.
frlmphl.v $e |- V = ( Base ` Y ) $.
frlmphl.j $e |- ., = ( .i ` Y ) $.
frlmphl.o $e |- O = ( 0g ` Y ) $.
frlmphl.0 $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` R ) $.
frlmphl.s $e |- .* = ( *r ` R ) $.
frlmphl.f $e |- ( ph -> R e. Field ) $.
frlmphl.m $e |- ( ( ph /\ g e. V /\ ( g ., g ) = .0. ) -> g = O ) $.
frlmphl.u $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> ( .* ` x ) = x ) $.
frlmphl.i $e |- ( ph -> I e. W ) $.
frlmphl $p |- ( ph -> Y e. PreHil ) $.
$d .* x $.
$d ., g x $.
$d .0. g x $.
$d .x. g x $.
$d B g x $.
$d I g x $.
$d O g $.
$d R g x $.
$d V g x $.
$d W g x $.
$d Y g x $.
$d g ph x $.
$d g x $.
$d g x $.
$d g x $.
